title: Can I use the Debt Resolution program as a Permanent Resident?
question: I hold a green card based on employment and I am looking for the best way to take care of my debt to credit cards. Filing for the debt resolution program due to financial hardship, am I jeopardizing my green card status? Furthermore, is it going to have a negative effect on my future application for citizenship?
question_tags: Immigration,Green cards,Immigrants and credit cards,Bankruptcy,Debt,Debt settlement,Debt relief,Bankruptcy and debt,Employment,Citizenship application
answers: Must be very careful when dealing with debt negotiating companies. Most are not legitimate and creditors will never be paid. Consult with a local bankruptcy attorney for options with your debt.

I think bankruptcy and debt settlement will not hurt your status. However, debt settlement companies may be a rip off. Maybe there is an honest outfit but I have never heard o that that is.

I want you to have a consultation with one or more bankruptcy lawyers. Not because bankruptcy is necessarily the answer, but because bankruptcy lawyers are experts at giving debt relief advice. Most BK lawyers will give you a free consultation. Your creditors all have legal advice, why shouldn't you have the same? Especially, when it is free.
